page.title: 13MEDIA CONTINUED
page.content: TELEVISION In nearly every home the TV has taken the place of the fireplace, with furniture turned toward it. Pro- grammes are on all day, but it is after school and evening, when it takes over life for some families. There are four channels plus CEFAX and Oracle for up to date information. BBC 1 and 2 are nationwide, whereas commercial channels vary - here we pick up Anglia. Many programmes are bought from the USA, they are popular, but the best quality work is home-produced - wild life, documentary, investigatory and comedy series attract a big audience. READING MATERIAL Most read newspapers are The Sun', Daily Mirror' and Daily Telegraph'. Homes get 2 free local papers and buy The Advertise'. Books are borrowed from libraries rather than bought - other than childs.
